treatment.description: Canes smooth and without (or with exceptional and very remote) prickles, 0.5-3 m. high, erect or high-arching; primocane-leaves with smooth petioles or exceptionally with 1 or 2 small prickles; leaflets (3-)5(-7), ovate or ovate-lanceolate, long-acuminate, glabrous on both surfaces, the median and terminal ones long-petiolulate, the terminal with broadly rounded to cordate base; floricanes strongly ascending (unless lodged by heavy snow); primary inflorescences elongate racemes of numerous (up to 25) flowers, standing well above the basal foliaceous bracts; most bracts reduced and stipuliform, the rachis minutely pilose; petals 1.2-2 cm. long, 6-12 mm. broad; fruit globose to thimble-shaped, -12 mm. long, dryish or in some colonies juicy and of rich quality. (R. Millspaughii Britt.; R. Randii (Bailey) Rydb., the smallest extreme)
